description_txt: stated on December 13, 2013 in a mailing to 13th Congressional District voters:
quote_txt: "Since 2007 David Jolly has given almost $30,000 to keep Democrats in Congress!"

description_txt: stated on December 13, 2013 in David Jolly in a mailer to 13th Congressional District voters:
quote_txt: "Kathleen Peters refuses to ‘take a stand’ to repeal Obamacare."

description_txt: stated on December 10, 2013 in an email blast:
quote_txt: "This is the first time in Texas history -- and only the fourth time in United States history -- that two women are running for the top spots."

description_txt: stated on December 15, 2013 in an interview on MSNBC's "Up":
quote_txt: "A quarter of our workers make $18,000 per year."

description_txt: stated on November 19, 2013 in a book:
quote_txt: Protesters in La Crosse blocked an exit and surrounded a State Patrol car carrying the governor and were "beating on the windows and rocking the vehicle." When the car was "extricated" from the crowd, a truck blocked a second exit.

description_txt: stated on December 22, 2013 in comments on "Fox News Sunday":
quote_txt: "Most of the (Affordable Care Act) has already in some sense been waived or otherwise suspended."

description_txt: stated on December 22, 2013 in comments on ABC's "This Week":
quote_txt: Says President Barack Obama "came into office very concerned about" wiretappings but "then he became president of the United States, he got all the briefings … (and) he decided … the balance is probably pretty appropriately struck."

description_txt: stated on December 19, 2013 in comments on his radio program:
quote_txt: To comply with non-discrimination laws, the government is "forcing people in business to make wedding cakes" for anyone.

description_txt: stated on December 2, 2013 in response to subpoenas being sent out over a bridge lane-closure controversy:
quote_txt: "The fact that one town has three lanes dedicated to it, that kind of gets me sauced."

description_txt: stated on December 13, 2013 in an interview:
quote_txt: "Scott Walker raises nearly 70 percent of his money from out of state"

description_txt: stated on December 11, 2013 in an advertisement:
quote_txt: "Rhode Island’s teen binge drinking rate is double the national average."

description_txt: stated on November 19, 2013 in a web posting:
quote_txt: Says Gov. Scott Walker dropped out or was kicked out of college short of a degree "not long after" he was "kicked out of student elections at Marquette University."

description_txt: stated on October 28, 2013 in speech to the Nashua Rotary Club :
quote_txt: "I’m ninth generation from New Hampshire."

description_txt: stated on December 15, 2013 in an oped column:
quote_txt: Federal law for Obamacare navigators "does not bar — or even require screening for — convicted felons, including individuals convicted of identity theft or fraud."

description_txt: stated on December 4, 2013 in a talk to the Human Services Coalition of Oregon:
quote_txt: "60 percent of the jobs lost in the 2008 recession were living-wage jobs. Of the jobs we’ve gotten back, only 40 percent are living-wage."

description_txt: stated on December 16, 2013 in an interview with the 'Tampa Bay Times':
quote_txt: Studies suggest the 2017 College Football Playoff Championship game will bring about 1,700 to 1,800 full-time jobs.

description_txt: stated on December 5, 2013 in a meeting:
quote_txt: Gov. Scott Walker bought "80 new, brand-new vehicles" for the state that "we probably don’t need."

description_txt: stated on November 22, 2013 in a mailer:
quote_txt: The economic impact of new Atlanta Braves stadium includes 9,241 new jobs and $295 million in wages.

description_txt: stated on December 18, 2013 in a broadcast of MSNBC's "The Cycle":
quote_txt: "There never really was a 'Hastert Rule.' "

description_txt: stated on December 11, 2013 in an interview on Oregon Public Broadcasting:
quote_txt: "We don’t show people playing these games. We don’t show them winning playing the video lottery games."

description_txt: stated on December 17, 2013 in a Facebook post:
quote_txt: "Florida has experienced positive job growth for 39 consecutive months."

description_txt: stated on December 16, 2013 in a segment on MSNBC's "Morning Joe":
quote_txt: The United States is "behind many countries in Europe in terms of the ability of every kid in America to get ahead."

description_txt: stated on December 10, 2013 in a press conference:
quote_txt: The Murray-Ryan deal "is the first divided-government budget agreement since 1986."

description_txt: stated on December 14, 2013 in a Facebook post:
quote_txt: "The latest Quinnipiac poll found that nearly six-in-ten Americans oppose ObamaCare -- 30% support the law and 57% oppose it."

description_txt: stated on December 15, 2013 in an opinion column:
quote_txt: "Texas has the highest rate of uninsured in the nation. ... And there are more uninsured children in Texas than in any other state."

description_txt: stated on December 15, 2013 in an interview on CNN's "State of the Union":
quote_txt: "Medicare costs have slowed down dramatically. In fact, the first two months of this fiscal year, Medicare costs were down even in nominal terms relative to the previous year."

description_txt: stated on December 13, 2013 in an op-ed:
quote_txt: Says Marco Rubio endorsed Obamacare for his own family.

description_txt: stated on December 16, 2013 in a broadcast of "Hardball":
quote_txt: "Every dollar spent in the new Obamacare system ... goes to private-sector insurance companies."

description_txt: stated on December 11, 2013 in an online video:
quote_txt: Gov. Rick Scott "backed the federal shutdown."

description_txt: stated on December 3, 2013 in a post on her campaign website:
quote_txt: Greg Abbott defended more than $5 billion in public school funding cuts in fighting hundreds of school districts in court.
